content:
This PR proves n.divisors = { f.prod (· ^ ·) | f ≤ n.factorization } and variants.
It was delegated to @Eric Wieser 2 weeks ago so it is off the queue and I'm not sure how to proceed.
Reviews appreciated if anyone has anything to add.
Thanks!
I'm really lost on what to do here, can any maintainers help please?
#34554 is off the queue but I can't do anything. I could try removing the delegated label manually I guess?
Let's ping @Eric Wieser @Bhavik Mehta @Johan Commelin who commented on the PR.
@Snir Broshi thanks for pinging us, I left one more review, but I think this should be almost ready to go

@Bryan Gin-ge Chen I guess this points at a problem with the way we've defined the queue atm.

I guess it's non-trivial to distinguish between "delegated-to-author" and "delegated-to-other"?
Or can we split up the label like that? Because "delegated-to-other" shouldn't move things out of the queue.
I think it actually wouldn't be hard to distinguish in the labeling bot, since the syntax used in the comment when delegating to others vs the author is different.
